definitions.definition: To strip, deprive, or dispossess (someone) of something (such as a right, passion, privilege, or prejudice).

parsedExamples.example: You shall never divest me of my right to free speech.
When I wake up, I make a point to divest myself of all my prejudices, ready to start the day.
